variables.name: SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLSubagentLastMsgText

description: A hicomSQLsessionFinished trap indicates the completion of
an SQL query. If hicomSQLsessionState indicates an error in
the query, hicomSQLsessionResultLines will contain the SQL
error code instead of the number of resulting lines. In this
case, no entry in the hicomSQLresultTable will be created.

Summary.eval: ($v2 == 4) ? 'SQL query failed with error code $v4' : (($v2 == 5) ? 'SQL query succeeded' : 'SQL session state is $v2')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionFinished SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionId i 9999 SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionState i 1 SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionResultSize i 9999 SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionResultNoLines i 9999

description: Unique identifier of the SQL session.
variables.name: SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionId

description: Indicates current state of the SQL session:
idle: entry/session has been created by the
agent and has to be initialized by
the manager.
run: to be set by the manager to initiate the
execution of the SQL query.
error: execution of the SQL query resulted in
an error
valid: execution of the SQL query was
successful.
Transitions:
idle -> run -> {valid, error}
variables.name: SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionState

description: The result of a SQL query is stored in result
file. hicomSQLsessionResultSize specifies the
size in number of octets of the result file.
variables.name: SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionResultSize

description: The result of a SQL query is stored in result
file. hicomSQLsessionResultNoLines specifies
the number of lines in the result file.
variables.name: SIEMENS-PN-MIB::hicomSQLsessionResultNoLines
